page.title: 20Changing Times.
page.content: We interviewd 78 year old Mrs Evans who was born in 1907 and has lived in this area all her life. We asked her how things have changed in Midsomer Norton since 1925. Talking about food and cooking she said :"As there were no refridgerators in 1925 people kept food outside in a safe and they had a meat slab in the pantry to keep the meat cold.Most people kept pigs in the garden and kept the bacon hanging from the ceiling. Most people grew their own vegetables and fruit was widely available from orchards, which have largely disappeared now. Cooking was much slower and most people had a coal-fired range in the kitchen." "It was much stricter for children in those days-you only spoke when you were spoken to and if you had visitors you had to behave and sit still."
